position.marginalia_text: Archidoxis Theophrastiae pars prima Noven lirbi de misterijs Naturae Theophr. Bombast de Hohenb. Suevij Heremitae, Naturalium rerum docti Paracelsi Mag[ist]ri Phi[lippus] industriasissimi lib[er] 1. de misterijs Microcosmi [liber] 2. [de misterijs] elementor[um] [liber] 3. [de misterijs] s[anct]a essentia [liber] 4. [de misterijs] Arcani [liber] 5. [de misterijs] ...tractionum [liber] 6. [de misterijs] s... [liber] 7. [de misterijs] ... [liber] 8. De misterijs extremis liber 9 De praxi, sed no[n] est impressus

marginalia.translation: The first part of Theophrastus' Archidoxa Nine books on the mysteries of nature by Theophrastus Bombast of Hohenberg, Paracelsus learned in natural matters Book 1 On the mysteries of the microcosmos Book 2 On the mysteries of the elements Book 3 On the mysteries of the holy essence Book 4 On the mysteries of the arcane Book 5 On the mysteries of the ... Book 6 On the mysteries of the Book 7 On the mysteries of the Book 8 On the extreme mysteries Book 9 On the practice, but it is not printed yet.

position.marginalia_text: This above written and the name on the top of the frontisspice of this booke [and] ... writing in the middle of the fro[n]tisspice and the severall notes in the margent through the whole booke, was written by that famous Philosopher and Chimist John Dee. with his owne hand. this J[ohn] Dee ...was hay... wrote the philosophicall treatise called Monae Hieroglifica. also Propaideumata Aphoriastic also the learned preace before Euclides elementa in English in folio. he was warden of Manchester. I have dito ere books y were his ... he hath written his name and manz notes .. he for with thez are worthy.. the more ..... John Winthrop. Juli 24 1640..
